content:
Here's a WIP for of changing the background color of the sidebars.

Light Mode

The light mode definitely looks good with additional contrast added from the sidebars. This might need only some polishing that I'll work on once I get some feedback.

sidebar-light.png sidebar-stream-top-light.png

Dark Mode

The dark mode on the other hand looks out of place as it doesn't go well the color of the message area, this in contrast to @Vlad Korobov 's full implementation where the color of all the components are tied together in harmony.

siebar-dark-only.png sidebar-stream-top-dark.png

(I have only stuck with changing the sidebar colors in the above description as was mentioned by the issue)

I also experimented a little on the dark mode based on the screenshots provided by @Vlad Korobov. This may provide some idea about how the sequential color changes of different components play together.

siebar-dark-only.png

sidebar-topbar-dark.png

all-dark.png

I do like all-dark.png Without that it is not great but not critical considering we are replacing every part soon. So I'm ok with both but prefer the latest screenshot. @Alya Abbott please advise on the tactic here.
Cool, thanks for taking this up Sayam Samal ! I think there are more views we need to see to evaluate how it's all working together. I'll post a comment on the GitHub issue.
Or, actually, I wonder if you can submit a PR? Playing with it in dev will be better than looking at screenshots in any case.
You can put the dark mode changes into a separate commit so that we can decide whether to apply both.
Surely, I'll work on submitting a [WIP] PR soon.

@Alya Abbott Regarding the dark mode changes, which one of the out of sidebar-dark-only/sidebar-topbar-dark/all-dark should I include in the commits?

One caveat of going all-dark would be to change the color of the whole UI to go along with it, which I think is something we reserve on doing later on?

Hm, all-dark looks much better to me than the intermediate dark theme options. Unless there's some engineering reason why it wouldn't be possible, I think you should put that in the PR, and we can poke around to see if it makes anything else look weird.
Yeah, that plan sounds good to me.

@Alya Abbott @Vlad Korobov Could you please confirm if this is the look we are aiming for in the dark mode,
image.png

As mentioned in the comments(#1, #2), I have extended the dark grey to the surroundings of the message cards.

@Vlad Korobov can say more about how to fix this if it's unclear, but the message header bar needs to have its own background rather than blending with the overall background; see screenshot in the issue description.

image.png

@Alya Abbott the message headers in redesign has a different UI than the current one in use, so I hadn't updated the background colors for them. I also have missing information regarding the opacity value of those translucent type background colors. I tried prototyping some iterations eyeballing the values, I'll post them below.

image.png

and make a stroke around recipient bar too image.png
image.png

We may be able to avoid dealing with this type of separator, as Remove date separators immediately followed by a recipient bar #22966 has an open PR (#23099).
Hi! I'm working on this and have encountered some questions

(1) It seems like the grey we picked for the background is the same color as the current recipient bar. @Vlad Korobov is there a color that would be good to switch it to while we wait on the actual redesign?

image.png

(2) Where do we want to keep white vs move to grey in the Recent Conversations view? Thoughts on this?

image.png

(3) Should we keep the compose box white, or just give it a stronger border?

image.png

image.png

image.png

image.png

Changing background color is not easy. I think we should focus on other components of the redesign first. You also need to adjust color for all overlays, popovers, dropdowns etc and their various components.
This issue is supposedly "just the sidebar", but yeah that's a reasonable point. Curious what Tim/Alya/Vlad think.
I think this PR could be limited to everything directly on the page, not any overlays or dropdowns.
You can get away with that in the light theme, but it will be very noticeable in dark theme.

I think this PR could be limited to everything directly on the page, not any overlays or dropdowns.

Yeah, I think our aim should be roughly to start with the minimal scope of changes that will look good -- at least as good as the current UI, hopefully somewhat better, but totally fine if it's not as good as the fully redesigned look.
It's a bit hard to judge what that scope is without playing around with a PR and seeing what looks off.
I am trying to prioritize working on recipient header redesign so that we can merge it before this.
@Alya Abbott @Vlad Korobov can you take a look at #23724 and see how it feels? I think I've caught most of the surfaces, but I'd love some more eyes.
